etymology.description: 预(advance) + 定(set/fix) = set in advance → schedule; book.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates fixing or arranging something ahead of time. Commonly used for reservations, bookings, and scheduling.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 預定 → Simplified 预定: 預 was simplified to 预 by reducing the 頁 component (頁→页) and streamlining strokes; 定 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们已经预定了明天的会议(我們已經預定了明天的會議)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐjīng yùdìng le míngtiān de huìyì.
examples.english: We have already scheduled tomorrow’s meeting.

examples.chinese: 请帮我预定两张去上海的火车票(請幫我預定兩張去上海的火車票)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bāng wǒ yùdìng liǎng zhāng qù Shànghǎi de huǒchē piào.
examples.english: Please help me book two train tickets to Shanghai.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅需要提前预定(這家餐廳需要提前預定)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng xūyào tíqián yùdìng.
